unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Boosts Efficiency**
normalised: manufacturing and supply chain quality control boosts efficiency

unnormalised: Mumbai, India - Manufacturing firms are increasingly focusing on robust quality control measures to optimize their supply chains and enhance competitiveness, especially with the festive season approaching. A recent study by IIM Bangalore highlights that Indian companies implementing rigorous quality checks see a 15% reduction in production defects.
normalised: Mumbai, India - Manufacturing firms are increasingly focusing on robust quality control measures to optimize their supply chains and enhance competitiveness, especially with the festive season approaching. A recent study by I I M Bangalore highlights that Indian companies implementing rigorous quality checks see a fifteen percent reduction in production defects.

unnormalised: "Like ensuring every grain of rice in a perfect biryani is cooked just right, meticulous quality control at each stage of manufacturing is crucial," explains Dr. Priya Sharma, a lead researcher at IIM. Companies are adopting advanced technologies such as AI-powered inspection systems and real-time data analytics to identify and address potential issues early on.

unnormalised: This surge in quality consciousness comes as manufacturers gear up for increased demand during festivals like Onam. Better quality control translates to fewer returns, reduced waste, and ultimately, happier customers. Even small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) are investing in employee training programs focusing on quality standards, signaling a nationwide commitment to manufacturing excellence. This is expected to boost the sector's contribution to India's GDP by 2% in the next financial year.
